p: Infection with low pathogenicity avian influenza (LPAI) viruses is widespread and in many countries has led to outbreaks in domestic birds [1]. Although LPAI strains do not pose a serious concern for animal health, LPAI subtypes H5 and H7 may mutate into highly pathogenic strains (HPAI) [2], outbreaks of which can threaten human health [3], in addition to causing huge economic losses due to high bird-mortality rates and to the cost of control measures [4].
